steps.step: Wash and peel the kiwis.
Cut them into thin slices. Wash the mint sprigs.
Place kiwi slices and mint in a large jar/bottle.Fill the jar/bottle with water and cover.
Place in the fridge and chill for at least 2 hours, for best results overnight.
First, prepare your glasses.
Pour a 4 inch circle of kosher salt on a plate, run an open lime around the rim of the glass and then dip the rim of the glass in the salt.
Let it dry for a minute or two.  Be careful when adding ice to the glass - you don't want to knock the salt off the rim.

Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with crushed ice, shake and strain into your prepared glass.  Then, pour a tablespoon or so of the Del Maguey Chichicapa Mezcal over the top.  Finally, garnish with a lime, serve, and let the Margarita Madness begin!

extendedIngredients.name: quality
extendedIngredients.original: 2 ounces quality, good silver tequila (Herradura is nice)
extendedIngredients.originalName: quality, good silver tequila (Herradura is nice)

steps.step: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice.
Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice.
Pour the rum and top with soda water.
Garnish and serve with straw.
Serve over ice.
Shake all ingredients (except for the cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Fill a tall glass with ice cubes, and fill 1/3 full with grapefruit juice. Top up the remaining 2/3 with ginger ale, then add some cranberries and mint leaves for garnish if you like!
Add the cocoa, sugar and cinnamon to a large coffee cup or mug.
Heat the milk in a small pot on the stove or in a separate cup in the microwave until it's just hot but not boiling.
Add the warm milk to the dry ingredients and stir well.Top with whipped cream and extra cinnamon, if desired.
Shake all ingredients (except slices of lemon and lime) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the slices of lemon and lime and serve.
Combine gin, sugar, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.
Add tea bags to pitcher of water and let set for 1 hour. Dispose bags. You may need to take out some of the tea from the pitcher to allow room for the Bourbon and fruit.
Add sliced strawberries, lemon juice, mint and Bourbon.
For optimal taste, let it set in the refrigerator for an hour before serving.
Pour over ice and enjoy!

extendedIngredients.name: pitcher of water
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pitcher of water (8 cups of water)
extendedIngredients.originalName: pitcher of water (8 cups of water)

extendedIngredients.name: mango tea bags
extendedIngredients.original: 8 mango black tea bags, or other fruity flavored tea
extendedIngredients.originalName: mango black tea bags, or other fruity flavored tea

extendedIngredients.name: mint
extendedIngredients.original: 1/3 cup fresh mint, chopped or muddled

steps.step: Boil water in a pan with five spices, black cardamom, green cardamom, crushed pepper corns, cinnamon & cloves (lightly crush to bring out the  flavors).Cover the pan with lid, as to my experience, there is a huge difference in the aroma of tea made covered and uncovered.Bring the water to boil and add Tea Leaves.
Let the tea leaves brew for 4-5 minutes in boiling water.

Add 1/2 cup of milk and sugar to taste at this point & simmer for few minutes.When the tea is done, give it a grace period of another one to two minutes with lid covered, to let the spices lose all their flavor to the chai.Use a strainer to filter the tea into your tea cup.
Juice the fruits.
Put the mixture in a clean, clear glass.Sweeten the concoction with honey.Put a dash of salt.
Add mints.Put ice.
Add soda water up to the tip of your glass.Enjoy while its cold.

extendedIngredients.name: mint leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 5 pieces Mint leaves, washed and chopped

extendedIngredients.name: soda water up to the tip of the glass
extendedIngredients.nameClean: soda water up to the tip of the glass
extendedIngredients.original: 1/3 cup Soda water up to the tip of the glass
extendedIngredients.originalName: Soda water up to the tip of the glass

steps.step: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass.
Garnish.
Fill a 12 oz cocktail glass tumbler 3/4 of the way with ice.
Add the vodka, horseradish, Worcestershire, hot sauce, and vegetable juice.

Pour into a cocktail shaker, shake well, and let rest.Meanwhile, wet the rim of the glass and coat it with the Creole seasoning. Pout the drink back into the glass and garnish with the celery and pepperoncini.To make multiple drinks, just set up each glass with the drink ingredients and shake one at a time.

extendedIngredients.name: es of hot sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 2 1 tablespoones of hot sauce, such as Tabasco or Crystal
extendedIngredients.originalName: es of hot sauce, such as Tabasco or Crystal

extendedIngredients.name: vegetable juice
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup of vegetable juice, such as V-8

steps.step: In a large saucepan, add the almond milk, shredded coconut, sliced almonds, sugar, dates, split vanilla bean and seeds, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, and vanilla extract.

Place over medium heat and slowly bring to a simmer, whisking occasionally.Once simmering, reduce the heat to low and cook for 20 minutes. Be careful not to boil.Turn off the heat and let steep for 10 minutes.

Remove the vanilla bean and cinnamon sticks and discard.Using a kitchen blender, and working in batches, blend the eggnog on high for about 1 minute. Stain the eggnog through a fine chinois (strainer) into a glass or metal bowl. Using a wooden spoon, gently press the strained solids firmly against the chinois to extract as much liquid and flavor as possible.  Dispose of the solids. Repeat this process with the remaining mixture.Chill the strained eggnog for at least 1 hour or more if serving cold
To serve, stir about 1 tablespoon of rum per 1 cup of eggnog. Ladle into serving glasses and garnish with a dash of nutmeg on top. If serving warm, add the rum and enjoy right away.

extendedIngredients.name: ground nutmeg
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4-1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, plus more for garnish
extendedIngredients.originalName: ground nutmeg, plus more for garnish
